values:
Friends, Romans, noblemen...lend me your ears!

Sorry for my long abscence. Again, it was the password thing. I apoligize for my carelessness.

Oh, who am I kidding? How long can I keep using that lame excuse? Fact of the matter is...while in Asia for that film festival I got addicted to white opium.

Yes, she is a cruel mistress. I must now call upon my celebrity friends to help me in my time of need.

Garey Busey, Robert Downey Jr., Nick Nolte, Courtney Love! They will....oh, shit. Well, I'm fucked.

Yeah.

Today I tried to purchase a cellular phone but something went awry.

See, I had no idea that there was this thing called "credit" and that when I bought Deloreans just to crash into swamps during the 1980s that I was "ruining" it.

I still got my cordless phone though...and they can't take that away...


unless I forget to pay my bill...again.

Hey, aren't crackers the best? I've been on a real cracker kick lately. All kinds. I'm eating triscuits now and I had some cheez-its a fornight ago. What's your favorite kind of cracker? Hey, speaking of crakers...I can't believe I've never guest starred on "Walker, Texas Ranger". That's fucking crazy, man.

CRAZY...MAN.

Where have I been?

Buried under an avalanche?
Stranded on a deserted island?
Stuck to my couch like that fat lady who died?
Dead in a ditch somewhere?

No, my friends, the answer is a simple one.

One that I will share with you now.

The truth of the matter is that I lost my limbs in a poker match with a Korean shop owner in a shack out in the Nevada desert. The limbs were shipped to an Asian fusion restuarant in Hawaii. I paid a German man to build me a full body robotic suit with arms and legs so that I may walk and function like a normal member of society.

With my strange robot suit (think Woody Allen in "Sleeper"), I hopped the first fan-boat to Honolulu.

Once I arrived, I was greeted by some tough guys posing as Cabana boys at the Marriot resort. My super-human-German-made-Robot-like strength made quick work of the hoodlums and I made my noisy, beep filled way to "Miso Sowy's Noodle Haus and Grill". After being held up in a long and pointless conversation with a waiter (who looked suspiciously like Tom Arnold), I kung-fooed my way into the kitchen where I karate chopped some chink who was about to turn my toes into soup.

And it's simple as that, really. I swam back to L.A. Sold my robot body for scrap, used that money to get my limbs surgically re-attached and then told the good people at Earthlink that I would be able to pay them for their services this month.

Ta DA! I'm back!

The truth of the matter is that I lost my password to this thing.

I've been sitting in front of my computer entering word after word until I finally hit jack pot!

I'm happy my nightmare is over.

I could really use a Mountain Dew.
Read it and weep The Seagal is back...on deadly ground, nigga.

What a difference a day makes!

Today, I recieved an invition to introduce a retrospective of my films at an Action Film Festival in Austria. They were going to have it in Iraq but I told them that I refuse to do anything like that "on deadly ground".

Get it? That's one of my movies!

If you don't get it, you should seize the joke. Take the joke "under siege".

Ha! Zing! AGAIN!

Thank you, Austria. You have given me a new reason to live. Goodbye, Viagra!

I am down with a touch of something. I think it's either the Asian bird flu thing or a sexually transmitted disease. In any case, I haven't felt the energy to post much lately. I apoligize to my fan.

Keep it real.

I am off to play some video games and drink some orange juice.

XOXO,
Steven.

I heard recently the rumor that Andy Kaufman was back from the dead. Then I heard it was debunked.

Who is this Andy Kaufman? Some sort of zombie? Some sort of ghost? Whoever he was/is, he sounds like a jew.

Things are looking up. A Korean man offered me 50$ a week to live in his garage and do martial arts at his children's whim. Also, I've receieved another fan letter:

Dear Steven,
Me and my wife are expecting our first son in August. I insist we name it after my Grandfather ("James"), she wants to name it "Gerald". What should be done about this? Outside of marriage counseling? Or a court of law? Or reality t.v?

-Troube In Topeka.

Dear TIT,
This is a common problem. I say you name the child something completely neutral, like "Steven" or "Seagal".

XOXO, Steven.

Yeah, it's not so much a fan letter as it is an advice column but it's the first time I've gotten mail not addressed to "The Pizza Lover @ 12550 Racho Dr" in a long time.

Gray skies are gonna clear up, put on a happy face.

Dear lord, I hate that song.

I opened the frigde today and all that was there was a jar of pickle juice.

I need a gig and quick. Something, anything. Straight to video? Nordic porn? Industrial videos? I can play a pretty good "example of a bad employee".

Jet Li should return my phone calls.

Today my sisters faggy kids came over. We ate ice cream, looked at internet porn, took turns wearing my jacket (I had firsties) and even took a picture! That is an exclusive for all you loyal readers. READ: Eat shit, Star Magazine. P.S-Gary Busey is a pussy.
Oh, Father! How I ache to join you! Living is a farce.

I think I may have a part in the upcoming "Batman" movie. I can't legally say anything more but let's just say I am going to have to get used to the smell of rubber real quick.

In other news, I got my jacket back from the dry cleaner and it's missing some fringe.

Lousy Asians.

"Actor's Studio" is off. I can't go into details but let's just say Lipton is in hot water. Wait, why does that sound so strange? Oh! Ha! Like the tea! I really like visual aids. They are like cue cards...except without words.

I got some money cause I just got paid.

"Exit Wounds" was shown on a Thai television station. That means 7 big ones in Steven's swiss bank account. Holla! Hello new slippers!

I tuned in on the satellite to see it. Channel 790. Being dubbed in Thai really makes DMX's performance seem (to quote Soundgarden)"outshined! outshined! outshined!!!"...by yours truly.

Cradle to tha grave, nigga.
Has there ever been a more glorious song ever written? In other news, I am going to be on "Inside the Actor's Studio" next month. Me and James Lipton? Can you say "Asshole-off"?

Just now I got this e-mail in my "inbox":

Dear Mr. Seagal,

I think you are wonderful. I've seen all of your movies. I really enjoy hearing your views on the world's problems. I especially agree about the fact that AIDs is a man made virus. Preach on, Steven! But there is more to this letter than simple compliments. I am fat...just like you. And you have inspired me to do something with my life! I could grow a ponytail, inspire people, wear fringe or make bad movies! Thank you for that! I hope you keep up your horseback riding and here's to turning pro! 

All my love,
Betsy.



Wow. To see that I can make that kind of difference is astonishing. Three cheers for me.

This is my first entry. Here goes nothing...

Last night I had dinner with Gary Busey.

We ate oysters and then swapped wives.
